doc:
Pete Smith (film producer) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pete_Smith_(film_producer) 0 Peter Schmidt (September 4, 1892 – January 12, 1979), known as Pete Smith, was an American publicist, short subject producer and narrator. A native of New York City, Smith began working as a publicist at Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer in the 1920s. He later moved into film making. He is best known for his series of shorts, the Pete Smith Specialties, which were in production from the 1930s to the 1950s. Smith produced and narrated over 150 shorts which earned him two Best Live Action Short Film Academy Awards. In 1953, he was awarded an Academy Honorary Award for his short films. Smith's later years were spent in a Santa Monica convalescent home due to ill health. In January 1979, Smith jumped to his death from the roof of the home. Peter_Schmidt ( September_4_,_1892 – January_12_,_1979 ) , known as Pete_Smith , was an_American_publicist , short_subject_producer_and_narrator . A_native of New_York_City , Smith began_working as a_publicist at Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer in the_1920s . He later moved into film_making . He is_best_known for his_series of shorts , the_Pete_Smith_Specialties , which were in production from the_1930s to the_1950s . Smith produced and narrated over 150_shorts which earned him two_Best_Live_Action_Short_Film_Academy_Awards . In 1953 , he was_awarded an_Academy_Honorary_Award for his_short_films . Smith 's_later_years were_spent in a_Santa_Monica_convalescent_home due to ill_health . In January_1979 , Smith jumped to his_death from the_roof of the_home .
